Great evening with some good food and a relaxed atmosphere.  This was a recommendation from the concierge of the hotel and it did not disappoint.  Food was reasonably priced and the quality was very high. Service was good and the usual Barcelona pace, although I must say the food did come out relatively fast. We chose the tapas option and went with a medley of choices.  Starting with a tomato and mozzarella salad with basil pesto style dressing..  Tomatoes were firm and juicy and mozzarella was soft and yielding but clearly fresh fresh....  The octopus was on a bed of sliced potatoes and was cooked with some zest op red pepper.  It worked well and gave the calamari a nice flavor. The fried eggplant with honey was tasty although at times felt too oily...perhaps a side of something or more honey would have helped. Anchovies were very tasty indeed and were served with some toasted bread. Salty as expected but deep flavor and not overpoweringly fishy. The grilled artichokes with chopped Iberia ham was delightfully complex with the salt of the ham draing out the grilled artichoke flavors.  Great experience.  Will be back.
